p: It is interesting to note that, despite the comparable level of antiviral activity and the less pronounced toxic properties of the PolyG:PolyC complex [ 61, 69], until recently, the creation of drugs based on the complex PolyI:PolyC was developed more intensively in world pharmaceutical practice. Most likely, one of the reasons for such preference consists in the technological problems of obtaining PolyG [ 58, 70], although other reasons are also possible (e.g. differences in the width and manifestation of the immunomodulating action of these complexes).
